context:
This program is designed for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing students in Ontario who want to upgrade their English, American Sign Language (ASL), and Math skills. The courses offered range from basic up to Academic and Career Entrance (ACE) level. ACE credits are recognized by Ontario colleges for admission to college and apprenticeship programs, and many employers accept the ACE certificate as equivalent to a high school diploma.

To apply, contact deafupgrading@georgebrown.ca. Eligible applicants must be age 19 or older, Deaf or Hard-of-Hearing, use ASL, and live in Ontario. The tuition for Ontario residents is free, and transportation subsidies are available for eligible students.

The courses run for 10 hours per week, for 15 weeks, from September and January at George Brown College's St. James Campus, located at 200 King Street East in Toronto. It may take between 1-2 years to complete the program, depending on other commitments.

For more information, contact deafupgrading@georgebrown.ca or visit their social media hub. Application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more can be kept up-to-date by signing up for notifications.

Contact information:
Email: deafupgrading@georgebrown.ca
Phone: 416-415-2000
TTY: 1-877-515-5559
ask.george@georgebrown.ca
